Definition at line 532 of file cpp2for.cpp.

References Vector3d::copyTo(), CStconfig::Flux(), and CStconfig::getBandGradients().

WINDLLEXPORT void STDCALL MCGETBCURLBGRADFCYL ( C3dMesh **  mConf,
double *  u,
double *  B,
double *  curlB,
double *  gradF 
)

The method returns B and curl(B) in cylindrical coordinates.

Parameters:
[in] mConf is the pointer to memory at which the address of C3dMesh-object is stored.
[in] u is the point (s,theta,phi) in magnetic coordinates.
[out] B is the magnetic field in cylindrical coordinates.
[out] curlB is the curl(B).
[out] gradF is the grad(torFlux)
Examples:

WINDLLEXPORT int STDCALL MCTRACELCMS ( C3dMesh **  mConf,
double *  R1,
double *  R2,
double *  Entry,
double *  Exit 
)

The method traces the Last Closed Magnetic Surface (LCMS).

The method finds intersections of the ray with the LCMS, where the ray is R(t)=r1+(r2-r1)/|r2-r1|*t, and t>=0.

Parameters:
mConf is the address of the variable which contains the address of C3dMesh-object
R1 is the cartesian coordinates of the first point of the ray, must be outside with respect to the LCMS.
R2 is the cartesian coordinates of the second point of the ray
Entry this vector at return contains the coordinates of the entry point of the ray into plasma
Exit this vector at return contains the coordinates of the exit point
Returns:
  • -2 -- the origin r1 of the ray lies inside LCMS;
  • -1 -- the ray does not enters into plasma;
  • 0 -- segment r1--r2 is outside plasma;
  • 1 -- only entry point lies on the segment r1--r2, i.e. r2 is inside plasma;
  • 2 -- entry and exit points lie on the segment r1--r2, i.e. r1 and r2 are outside plasma;
if returned value >= 0 then entry and exit points of the ray are in entrypoint and exitpoint
Examples:
cpp2for.cpp.

Definition at line 1135 of file cpp2for.cpp.

References Vector3d::abs(), Vector3d::copyTo(), degree, CRayTrace::getTraceRxyz(), CRayTrace::getTraceSize(), CStconfig::isOK(), CRayTrace::traceLast(), and CStconfig::xyzIsInside().

WINDLLEXPORT void STDCALL MCCOORDFIELDLINE ( C3dMesh **  mConf,
double *  mixCoord0,
double *  fcyl,
double *  magCoord 
)

The method returns magnetic coordinates of the point of a field line, that passes through the given point (s0,theta0,ficyl0).

The method calculates function

where is non zero for VMEC coordinates.

Parameters:
mConf is the address of the variable which contains the address of C3dMesh-object
[in] mixCoord0 is the point of B-line in mixed coordinates, where s and theta coincide with correspondent magnetic coordinates, but toroidal angle is cylindricyl angle
[in] fcyl is the cylindricyl angle
[out] magCoord is the magCoord(s0,theta(ficyl),phi(ficyl))

WINDLLEXPORT int STDCALL MCSAVEREDUCED ( C3dMesh **  mConf,
int *  nsmax,
double *  eps,
int *  appendWrite,
char *  fname,
int  i 
)

The function transforms the current magnetic configuration to new volume or to new mesh on s.

Parameters:
[in] mConf is the pointer to memory at which the address of C3dMesh-object is stored,
[in] *nsmax is the number of surfaces to store, if zero then the original flux surfaces are stored, otherwise store the surfaces using a new mesh which is equidistant on sqrt(s).
[in] *eps is the truncation level to reduce the number of harmonics used in summation, the only harmonics with m<M and |n|<N satisfying Bmn/B00 > eps are used in summation, eps<=1e-6 is a good choice.
[in] *appendWrite if true then the magnetic configuration is appended to a file set by next parameter,
[in] fname is the filename under which the configuration is saved.
[in] i is the strlen(fname), skip this parameter if this function is called from fortran.
Returns:
if the method succeeds, the return value is 1; 0 otherwise.
Examples:
cpp2for.cpp.

Definition at line 1732 of file cpp2for.cpp.

References False(), strtrim(), True(), CStconfig::truncate(), and CStconfig::writeasciiReduced().

WINDLLEXPORT void STDCALL MCGETGFACTORS ( C3dMesh **  mConf,
double *  s,
double *  Gw,
double *  Gs,
double *  Gv 
)

The methods return the bounce-averade gradB drift velocity of trapped particles averaged over flux surface.

See eq(21,26,28) for Gw,Gs,Gv in Physics of Plasmas 12,112507(2005), http://link.aip.org/link/doi/10.1063/1.2131848

Examples:
cpp2for.cpp.

WINDLLEXPORT void STDCALL MCGETEPSEFF ( C3dMesh **  mConf,
double *  s,
double *  epsEffGraz,
double *  epsEffDkes,
double *  epsEffVmec 
)

The method returns the effective helical ripple for transport.

See also:
V.V.Nemov, S.V.Kasilov, W. Kernbichler, and M.F.Heyn, Physics of Plasmas, vol. 6, 4622(1999), http://link.aip.org/link/PHPAEN/v6/i12/p4622/s1

28th EPS, http://epsppd.epfl.ch/Madeira/html/pdf/P5.055.pdf , EGA Vol.25A (2001) 1985-1988

Parameters:
[in] mConf is the pointer to memory at which the address of C3dMesh-object is stored,
[in] s is the normalized toroidal flux
[out] epsEffGraz -- using Graz definition of the minor radius dr=ds/<|grad(s)|>,
[out] epsEffDkes -- using DKES definition of minor radius r=sqrt(Flux(s)/(pi*B_00(s))),
[out] epsEffVmec -- using VMEC definition of minor radius r=a*sqrt(s),
Examples:
cpp2for.cpp.

Definition at line 1773 of file cpp2for.cpp.

References CStconfig::epsEffDkes(), CStconfig::epsEffGraz(), and CStconfig::epsEffVmec().

maxPoints is the number of points for creating look-up table

The method returns the parallel adiabatic invariant with the integral taken between two turning points according formula .

WINDLLEXPORT void STDCALL MCGETMAGCOORDATB ( C3dMesh **  mConf,
double *  mag,
double *  Bt,
double *  magBt 
)

The method returns the magnetic coordinates of the point (that belongs to the given field line) at which the magnetic field is equal to the given value.

Parameters:
mag defines the field line;
Bt is the magnetic field value, must be within the interval Bmin..Bmax for the considered field line; @param[out] magBt array with the magnetic coordinates at which the magnetic field value is Bt or array with elements (-1,Bmin,Bmax) if Bt is not within the interval Bmin..Bmax;
Note:
the method seaches the point of interest starting from the point where B=Bmin; Bmin is seached within one machine period (0<=phi<2*pi/Np) along given field line.
See also:
Jinvariant(), Bmin(double s), Bmax(double s)
Examples:
cpp2for.cpp.

Definition at line 1908 of file cpp2for.cpp.

References Vector3d::copyTo(), and CStconfig::getMagCoordAtB().

WINDLLEXPORT void STDCALL MCUSEMIXEDPRODUCTFORJACOBIAN ( C3dMesh **  mConf,
int *  yesNo 
)

If yesNo>0 then the method forces to use Jacobian=dX/dFlux*(dX/dtheta^dX/dphi) for calculating B field.
